hero_description: Building secure systems and automating complex workflows. Passionate about threat detection, algo-trading, and CTF challenges.
about_intro: Security-focused engineer with a passion for building automated solutions and tackling complex cybersecurity challenges. Currently pursuing Information Assurance at FPT University while working on real-world security projects.
about_detail: Experienced in SOC operations, network intrusion detection, and developing automation tools. Active CTF competitor with expertise in forensics, reverse engineering, and web exploitation.
project_nids_desc: Developed a hybrid NIDS integrating Suricata signature-based detection with ML models (Random Forest, XGBoost) trained on CICIDS2017 dataset. Features real-time alerting via Telegram API with 95% detection accuracy.
project_trading_desc: Algorithm-driven cryptocurrency trading bot with real-time market tracking and automated trade execution.
project_bot_desc: Telegram bot delivering real-time financial statements for 1600+ Vietnamese companies. Integrates web scraping tools with async processing for high-throughput data delivery.
project_keylogger_desc: Proof-of-concept malware analysis lab simulating a full attack lifecycle: phishing delivery, credential harvesting, persistence, and C2 exfiltration via Telegram.
project_keylogger_summary: This project is a controlled malware analysis lab designed to simulate the complete lifecycle of an information-stealing trojan. By embedding a keylogger within a seemingly harmless Snake game, it demonstrates how threat actors weaponize legitimate applications to evade detection.
project_keylogger_scenario: A victim receives a phishing email containing an attached 'Snake Game'. Upon execution, the trojanized game operates normally while silently deploying credential-harvesting and persistence modules in the background.
project_keylogger_tech3: Boot or Logon Autostart: Registry Run Keys
project_keylogger_impl3: Script added to Windows Startup folder
project_keylogger_impl5: Chrome SQLite database decryption via AES
project_keylogger_impl6: Data sent to attacker via Telegram Bot API
project_keylogger_phase1: The attack begins with a crafted phishing email containing the trojanized game as an attachment. Social engineering techniques convince the victim to download and execute the application.
project_keylogger_phase2: Upon execution, the Snake game runs normally as a decoy, providing no visible indication of malicious activity. Meanwhile, the embedded keylogger initializes and begins capturing all keyboard input using the pynput library.
project_keylogger_phase3: The malware performs two types of credential theft:
project_keylogger_cred1: Keylogging: All keystrokes are captured and stored locally in a hidden log file.
project_keylogger_cred2: Browser Credential Extraction: The malware accesses Chrome's Login Data SQLite database, decrypts stored passwords using Windows DPAPI, and harvests saved credentials.
project_keylogger_phase4: To maintain access across system reboots, the malware copies itself to the Windows Startup folder, ensuring automatic re-execution on every login.
project_keylogger_phase5: Harvested data is transmitted to the attacker via HTTPS requests to the Telegram Bot API. This technique leverages legitimate cloud infrastructure, making network-based detection challenging.
project_keylogger_detect1: Endpoint Detection: Monitor for processes accessing Chrome's Login Data database or Local State encryption key.
project_keylogger_detect2: Behavioral Analysis: Flag applications making HTTPS requests to api.telegram.org that were not explicitly whitelisted.
project_keylogger_detect3: Persistence Monitoring: Alert on new files created in the Startup folder, especially scripts or executables.
project_keylogger_detect4: Keylogger Detection: EDR solutions can detect SetWindowsHookEx API calls or unusual keyboard hook registrations.
project_keylogger_mitig1: Implement Application Whitelisting to prevent unauthorized executables from running.
project_keylogger_mitig2: Deploy Email Security Gateways with attachment sandboxing.
project_keylogger_mitig3: Enable Windows Credential Guard to protect browser credential stores.
project_keylogger_mitig4: Use Network Segmentation to restrict outbound connections to known C2 domains.
project_keylogger_mitig5: Conduct regular Security Awareness Training for phishing recognition.
project_keylogger_disclaimer: This project was developed strictly for educational and research purposes to demonstrate malware techniques and their detection. All testing was conducted in isolated lab environments. The techniques demonstrated should never be used for illegal or unethical activities. Always obtain proper authorization before conducting security testing.
project_keylogger_video_link: Watch how the keylogger operates inside the Snake game
ctf_ezlogic_desc: Hardware logic reverse engineering with Verilog signal analysis

ctf_tetriffic_desc: USB HID keystroke forensics with QR code reconstruction
ctf_verify_desc: SHA-256 hash verification and file integrity analysis
ctf_moonwalk_desc: SSTV (Slow Scan Television) audio signal decoding
ctf_gimme_desc: SharePoint CVE-2025-49704 exploitation with credential theft analysis

exp_prospire_desc:
• Architected and deployed Prospire Finance Bot, delivering real-time financial statements for over 1,600 Vietnamese enterprises.
  • Engineered high-performance scraping tools to efficiently analyze Vietnamese stock market data.
  • Developed Prospire Algo-Trading AI V1, an automated cryptocurrency trading system with proprietary strategies achieving $100k volume in the first week.
  • Created automation pipelines to sync crypto price feeds to Google Sheets for real-time performance tracking.
exp_viettel_desc:
• Onboarded customer websites to Cloudrity WAF, fine-tuning security rules to meet specific business requirements.
  • Deployed and configured Cloud WAF (Radware) to mitigate OWASP Top 10 threats (DDoS, SQLi, etc.).
  • Engineered comprehensive security policies: Signature-based, Custom Signatures, Rate Limiting, and API Protection.
  • Conducted security assessments using Burp Suite, ZAP, Kali Linux and performed in-depth log analysis.
  • Implemented DLP (Fortra) policies to prevent unauthorized data exfiltration.
exp_hpt_role: Security Engineer Intern | On Job Training Semester | Grade: 9.2/10
exp_hpt_desc:
• Performed in-depth analysis of MITRE ATT&CK credential access techniques, including network sniffing, unsecured credentials, and input capture.
  • Applied AI/ML models to improve detection accuracy and refine alert tuning for these threats.
  • Developed a proof-of-concept keylogger and data stealer, cleverly embedded in a Snake game, to simulate real-world cyber threats and demonstrate effective defense strategies.
writeup_ezlogic_summary: Reverse engineering a hardware logic system with position-dependent character encoding. Developed brute-force approach to recover flag character by character.
writeup_ezlogic_techniques: Verilog Analysis, Signal Tracing, Waveform Analysis, Character Brute Force
writeup_ezlogic_intro: This challenge involved reverse-engineering a hardware logic system. Analysis of schematic.pdf revealed a complex gate-level implementation requiring signal tracing.
writeup_ezlogic_analysis: Waveform analysis of EzLogic_tb.vcd showed data_out_all changes while success=0. Testing with prefix '0ops{' revealed position-dependent encoding.
writeup_ezlogic_breakthrough: Each character is encoded independently based on position. Developed character-by-character brute-force comparing data_out[i] with data_std[i].
writeup_forensics_summary: Memory forensics investigation revealing fileless malware persistence via Windows Registry Run keys with Base64-encoded credentials.
writeup_forensics_techniques: Memory Analysis, Volatility Framework, Registry Forensics, Base64 Decoding
writeup_forensics_mitre: T1547.001 Registry Run Keys, T1027 Obfuscation, T1552.002 Credentials in Registry
writeup_forensics_intro: Challenge provided Memory.raw dump and password-protected Gift.rar. Objective: extract credentials from memory to unlock archive.
writeup_forensics_analysis: Volatility analysis focused on persistence mechanisms. Registry Run keys revealed suspicious Base64-encoded value.
writeup_forensics_breakthrough: Decoded Base64: 'Password is {Fileless-Malware-Persistence}' enabled Gift.rar extraction.
writeup_unknowns_summary: Audio steganography challenge with flag hidden in frequency spectrum, visible through spectrogram analysis.
writeup_unknowns_techniques: Audio Forensics, Spectrogram Analysis, Frequency-Domain Steganography
writeup_unknowns_intro: WAV audio file requiring forensics analysis to identify hidden data through spectral visualization.
writeup_unknowns_analysis: Sonic Visualiser spectrogram layer revealed text patterns in frequency spectrum.
writeup_unknowns_result: Flag visible directly in spectrogram output.
writeup_tetriffic_summary: USB HID forensics combined with deterministic game analysis. Reconstructed partial QR code from Tetris gameplay.
writeup_tetriffic_techniques: USB Protocol Analysis, HID Keystroke Extraction, QR Reconstruction, Error Correction
writeup_tetriffic_mitre: T1056.001 Keylogging, T1200 Hardware Additions, T1001.002 Steganography
writeup_tetriffic_intro: Challenge combined tetris.pcapng USB capture with tetris.py game featuring predetermined block sequences.
writeup_tetriffic_analysis: Extracted USB HID keystrokes using tshark and custom parser. Replayed inputs in modified game.
writeup_tetriffic_breakthrough: Tetris grid formed partial QR code. Manual reconstruction in Excel + QRazyBox error correction decoded flag.
writeup_st3g0_summary: LSB steganography in PNG image with flag hidden in least significant bits of red channel.
writeup_st3g0_techniques: PNG Analysis, LSB Extraction, zsteg Tool
writeup_st3g0_intro: PNG file requiring LSB steganography analysis to extract hidden data from pixel values.
writeup_verify_summary: File integrity verification using SHA-256 hash comparison across multiple files.
writeup_verify_techniques: Hash Computation, File Integrity, Automated Verification
writeup_verify_intro: Given directory of files and target SHA-256 hash. Identify matching file and decrypt.
writeup_verify_analysis: Automated script computed SHA-256 for all files, identified match: 8eee7195.
writeup_moonwalk_summary: SSTV signal decoding from WAV audio file‚Äîtechnique used in Apollo lunar missions.
writeup_moonwalk_techniques: SSTV Protocol, Audio Signal Analysis, Radio Imaging
writeup_moonwalk_mitre: T1027 Obfuscation, T1001.003 Steganography, T1048 Alternative Protocol
writeup_moonwalk_intro: WAV exhibiting analog signal characteristics suggesting SSTV transmission encoding.
writeup_moonwalk_analysis: Research identified Slow Scan Television encoding‚Äîmethod for transmitting images via audio.
writeup_moonwalk_result: SSTV decoder converted audio to image revealing: picoCTF{beep_boop_im_in_space}
writeup_gimme_summary: SharePoint CVE-2025-49704 exploitation simulating credential theft attack with Chrome data exfiltration.
writeup_gimme_techniques: Deserialization Attack, PowerShell Payload, Chrome Credential Theft, IDA Analysis
writeup_gimme_mitre: T1190 Exploit Application, T1059.001 PowerShell, T1555.003 Browser Credentials, T1560.001 Encrypted Archive
writeup_gimme_intro: PCAP analysis revealing SharePoint ToolShell exploitation with CompressedDataTable deserialization payload.
writeup_gimme_analysis: Decoded Base64+GZIP payload revealed PowerShell downloading health_check.exe. Malware extracts Chrome Login Data into password-protected ZIP.
writeup_gimme_breakthrough: IDA analysis of GenPass1/2/3 functions revealed ZIP password: sup3r_S3(ReT_p4$$wod
writeup_gimme_detection: Monitor SharePoint for anomalous CompressedDataTable parameters. Alert on certutil decode chains. Detect Chrome database access.
writeup_for2_summary: Covert C2 communication via ICMP protocol. Attacker exfiltrated data using ping packets with ASCII art encoding.
writeup_for2_techniques: ICMP Tunneling, Packet Analysis, ASCII Art Extraction, C2 Detection
writeup_for2_mitre: T1095 Non-App Layer Protocol, T1048.003 Alternative Protocol, T1041 C2 Exfiltration
writeup_for2_intro: PCAP containing ICMP backdoor traffic with command execution: 'download C:\tmp\flag_1s_ck4mpj0n.txt'
writeup_for2_analysis: ICMP packets contained ASCII commands. TCP stream confirmed 'openfile on remote computers success'.
writeup_for2_breakthrough: Subsequent packets contained ASCII art spelling the flag in stylized text.
writeup_for2_detection: Monitor unusual ICMP sizes (>100 bytes). Alert on printable ASCII in ICMP payloads. Detect command strings.
writeup_re02_summary: XLM (Excel 4.0) macro analysis revealing obfuscated flag through multi-cell string manipulation.
writeup_re02_techniques: XLM Macro Analysis, olevba Deobfuscation, String Reversal
writeup_re02_mitre: T1059.005 Visual Basic, T1204.002 Malicious File, T1027 Obfuscation, T1140 Deobfuscation
writeup_re02_intro: Excel document with XLM macro launching calc.exe as decoy while hiding flag across cells B128, D70, E178.
writeup_re02_analysis: strings output showed 'reverse string in B128 + D70 + reverse string in E178' but contained false character.
writeup_re02_breakthrough: olevba properly deobfuscated macro showing actual cell values without erroneous '5' character.
writeup_re02_detection: Alert on XLM macro sheets. Monitor EXEC function calls. Detect Excel spawning child processes.
